name: Avoid Script Functions with High Fan-In (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all Script Functions with High Fan-In.
         The Fan-in of Script Function is the number of other Artifacts that are referencing it.
         When computing the Fan-In of an Artifact, multiple accesses to it from the same Artifact are counted as one access. 
         The threshold is a parameter and can be changed as per requirement.
output:
This report lists all Script Functions with a High Fan-In.
               
This QR provides the following information:
Script Function full name.
rationale: If an artifact is referenced by large number of artifacts, maintenance and evolution becomes difficult. This is because all the referencing artifacts need to be updated and\or retested.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of script functions with a High Fan-In.
